result.execSummary:
The defendant Shari S Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $450 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD  -  RESTITUTION HEARING IS PENDING -  plus surcharges.

timeConds.notes:
Huber & Work Crew is authorized, but DE is not eligible for the ELM.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Restitution is ordered in the amount of Zero.

0840-0850:  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  The defendant appears in person with Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  The vicitim is not present in court.  Attorney Krecjarek states that she has no evidence of restitution to offer since the victim has not been in contact with her.  Attorney Celebre moves to set restitution at zero; so ordered.  File and order forwarded to Br. 8.
Restitution hearing on October 14, 2016 at 08:30 am. - date confirmed with Atty Celebre.
File sent to Rm 300 for scheduling of restitution hrg.
Associated with Charge #2
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
for Restitution Order filed by Atty Trigg.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Shari S Hale, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court imposes and stays 180 days in the KCJ and sentence is withheld; DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 90 days in the KCJ commencing on 7/2/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized, but DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Court imposes a fine or $450 plus costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   Restitution to be determined through a restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse as DE is not stipulating to the restitution that is requested.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 14 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given.
